about 2 million Americans have type 1 diabetes and the number of cases is rising but the FDA recently approved a drug to delay the onset of symptoms for people at high risk in type 1 diabetes the immune system mistakenly destroys insulin producing cells in the pancreas the drug is an intravenous infusion of a specially designed monoclonal antibody called t-zield CBS News chief medical correspondent Dr John lapuke spoke with the immunologist who led a clinical trial for the drug instead of half of the people developing diabetes in two years half of the people developed diabetes in four years when you saw those results what was your reaction I was hoping it would be even longer but any time without diabetes is a gift and there&#39;s hope the same approach could one day be used for other autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis or Ms the drugs price is 193 thousand dollars people who have diabetes spend an average of ten thousand dollars a year on related medical expenses

Diabetes is a chronic disorder that affects
the way the body metabolizes sugar. Diabetics are at higher risk of developing
heart disease, blindness, and nerve damage. Therefore, it is essential to make sure they
are eating the right foods to keep their blood sugar in check. A healthy diet for diabetics should consist
of good carbs, fats, and healthy proteins Diabetics also need to make sure not to overeat
since it can raise their blood sugar levels. The following are some of the healthy food
options that diabetics should eat daily: 1. Olive oil There is a big misconception that if you have
type 2 diabetes, you cannot have any fats in your diet. This is false because unsaturated fats are
essential for a person with type 2 diabetes. Trans and saturated fats are the ones to stay
away from because they can promote weight gain and increase heart disease risks. Extra virgin olive oil is known for being
one of the “good fats,” but it also contains other healthy nutrients important to the body. It is rich in monounsaturated fats, which
studies have shown can help lower “bad” LDL cholesterol levels. Extra virgin olive oil also contains antioxidants,
which can help reduce oxidative stress in the body. This means that it can act as an anti-aging
agent by fighting free radicals and reducing oxidative stress. It can also prevent cardiovascular disease
and cancer. 2. Nuts &amp; Seeds Frequent nut and seed consumption can reduce
the risk of developing type 2 diabetes. This is because they are high in fiber, protein,
and healthy fats, which can help control blood sugar levels. Nuts and seeds, when eaten in moderation,
can protect people with diabetes from developing serious complications. However, it is important to note that people
with diabetes should limit the portion size because they are high in calories. 3. Eggs Eggs and other protein-rich foods can be an
important part of a diet for people with diabetes. They can help regulate blood sugar levels
and prevent severe spikes in the short term. Eggs are also rich in vitamins and minerals,
including antioxidants lutein &amp; zeaxanthin, which can help prevent diseases related to
the eye. Each egg only contains 80 calories. 4. Peanut Butter To help control blood sugar levels, experts
recommend adding some healthy carbs to your diet. Some people find that peanut butter is an
excellent substitute for refined carbohydrates like white bread and sugar. These people find that the energy from the
peanut butter lasts longer than the quick burst of energy from refined carbs. However, it would help to watch how much peanut
butter you eat and your salt intake because too much salt can cause high blood pressure
and other health problems. 5. Green Vegetables People with diabetes should increase their
intake of green vegetables like spinach, cabbage, or kale, to reduce their risk of developing
complications associated with diabetes. Furthermore, studies have shown that people
who eat green vegetables regularly are less likely to get type 2 diabetes or develop complications
from it. 6. Cinnamon Cinnamon can be used in various dishes for
flavor, but it also has some health benefits. Some research has found that cinnamon can
improve insulin sensitivity and reduce blood sugar levels in people who have type 2 diabetes. If you&#39;re interested in taking cinnamon supplements
or adding it to your food, be sure to use Ceylon cinnamon instead of Cassia cinnamon. Ceylon has more health benefits and fewer
unpleasant side effects. 7. Dark Chocolate Dark chocolate has many health benefits that
can help people with diabetes. Dark chocolate is high in antioxidants, which
can help to reduce free radicals in the body and combat inflammation. This means it may help to reduce the risk
of cardiovascular disease and protect against stroke or heart attack. It also has a higher cocoa content than milk
chocolate, which studies have shown to improve blood sugar control for people with type 2
diabetes after eating. 8. Beans and lentils Beans and lentils have a low glycemic index,
meaning they release their sugars into the bloodstream slower than most other foods. They also have a high fiber content with both
soluble and insoluble fiber, which can help lower blood sugar levels by slowing down digestion,
reducing the absorption of sugar from the gut, and increasing feelings of fullness. In addition to lowering blood sugar levels,
beans and lentils are also packed with protein that can help those who suffer from insulin
resistance or those on diabetic 9. Brown rice Brown rice is a whole grain that provides
fiber and some vitamins and minerals. White rice is a refined grain that has fiber
and many minerals removed, making it softer. Brown rice is healthier in many ways, but
people should still keep their carbohydrate intake in moderation to avoid weight gain. 10. Avocado Avocado contains monounsaturated fatty acids,
which are good for managing blood sugar levels and insulin resistance. It&#39;s also full of fiber and antioxidants that
help keep your body healthy and fit. A research study shows that people who eat
half an avocado with lunch or dinner for 12 weeks can lose more weight than those who
don&#39;t add avocados to their meal plan. That&#39;s a roundup of some foods for diabetics
to eat daily to maintain a healthy lifestyle and take care of their diabetes.

foreign medicine made easy now in today&#39;s video we&#39;re going to be discussing key things that you need to know about a medicine commonly used to help control type 2 diabetes which is called metformin in this video we&#39;re going to cover what metformin is used for and how it works who can and can&#39;t take it how and when to take it side effects potential effects in pregnancy and breastfeeding as well as possible interactions as ever if you do find this video useful please remember to give it a thumbs up and subscribe to the channel if you haven&#39;t done so already so what is metformin and what is it used for well metformin is a medicine commonly used to treat type 2 diabetes and gestational diabetes type 2 diabetes is a form of diabetes where the cells in the muscles fat and liver become resistant to the hormone insulin this means that it&#39;s harder for the body to control blood sugar levels gestational diabetes is a form of diabetes which is transient meaning that it occurs during pregnancy and then often disappears after you&#39;ve given birth now whilst these are the two main uses metformin can also be used to help prevent type 2 diabetes if you&#39;re at high risk of developing it and also in something called polycystic ovarian syndrome or PCOS although it&#39;s not officially approved for this use and in this video we&#39;re mainly going to be focusing on its use in diabetes in terms of how it works well metformin lowers your blood sugar levels by improving the way that your body handles insulin and it reduces the amount of sugar that your liver releases into the bloodstream so who can and can&#39;t cake metformin while typically most adults and children aged 10 and over can take Metformin however it&#39;s not suitable for certain individuals especially if you&#39;ve ever had an allergic reaction to metformin you&#39;ve got uncontrolled diabetes you have liver or kidney problems you have a severe infection and you&#39;re being treated for heart failure or you&#39;ve recently had a heart attack or if you&#39;ve got severe problems with your circulation or breathing difficulties or drink a lot of alcohol you may also need to stop taking Metformin before having surgery where general anesthetic is involved this means putting you to sleep for surgery and certain medical tests such as a scam involving an injection of a Dye that contains iodine into the blood this is not a full and comprehensive list and if you&#39;re uncertain about whether you should take Metformin then it&#39;s obviously best to speak to your doctor directly who&#39;s going to be able to advise you on the suitability of Metformin for you this list is just to give you a flavor of some of the key things when metformin might be contraindicated so now let&#39;s take a look and cover when to take metformin and how to take it well metformin typically comes as two different types of tablet standard tablets on the one hand and slow release tablets on the other and it&#39;s also available as a liquid and sachets for children and people who find it difficult to swallow tablets standard tablets release metformin into your body quickly and you may need to take them several times a day depending on what your doctor advises slow release tablets on the other hand work gradually so you don&#39;t have to take them as often in terms of dosing and strength while your doctor will tell you how many tablets to take a day but the maximum daily dose is usually 2 000 milligrams or two grams a day liquid metformin should be taken in five mil Doses and usually ranges between 500 and 1000 milligrams and sachets similarly come in similar doses your doctor will check your blood sugar levels regularly and may change your dose of Metformin if necessary and when you first start taking metformin you&#39;ll be advised to increase the dose slowly because this reduces the chances of getting side effects if you find that the side effects of standard metformin are affecting you too much then your doctor may suggest switching to slow release tablets in terms of how to take it well it&#39;s best to take Metformin tablets with or just after your evening meal to reduce the chances of getting side effects and you should swallow the metformin tablets hole with a drink of water rather than chewing them if you&#39;re taking metformin sachets then pour the powder into a glass and add water around 150 ml stir it if you need to until the water turns clear or slightly cloudy and then drink the metformin straight away treatment for diabetes is usually for life but if your kidneys are not working properly your doctor will tell you to stop taking metformin and switch you to a different medicine and remember don&#39;t stop taking metformin without talking to your doctor because if you stop taking it suddenly your blood sugar levels can go up and it can make your diabetes worse if you accidentally miss a dose of Metformin then skip the mistose and take the next dose of the usual time don&#39;t take two doses to make up for the Forgotten dose if you do take too much respectful and by accident then speak to your doctor you might experience some side effects like stomach pain loose bowel emotions or diarrhea fast breathing or weakness for example now what side effects can you possibly develop well like all medicines metformin can cause side effects although not everybody gets them now there are common side effects of metformin which happen in more than one in a hundred people and these include things such as feeling sick or nauseous being sick so vomiting diarrhea stomach ache loss of appetite and some people do complain of a metallic taste in the mouth taking metformin can also cause a vitamin B12 deficiency this may present with symptoms such as feeling very tired having muscle weakness a sore red tongue issues with your vision or sensation and for a full video on B12 deficiency symptoms and signs please do check out the other video on this channel your doctor it can check your vitamin B12 level and if they&#39;re too low they may prescribe vitamin B12 supplements these can be either as an injection or tablets now some people do ask can my blood sugar become too low from taking metformin well the good news is is that metformin doesn&#39;t usually cause low blood sugar this is known as hypoglycemia or hypos when it&#39;s taken on its own but hypos can happen when you take Metformin with other diabetes medicines such as insulin or glycocide so if you do take Metformin in combination with these other diabetic medications it&#39;s worth knowing about this as a possible side effect if you&#39;re planning to exercise more than usual then make sure you eat carbohydrates like bread pasta or cereals before during or after exercise and if you are diabetic you should always be carrying a fast acting carbohydrate with you so things like sugar cubes fruit juice or some sweets just in case your blood sugar levels do get too low I&#39;ve included more information about hypoglycemia and its symptoms in the description box box of this video you may also need to eat a starchy carbohydrate like a sandwich or a biscuit to maintain your blood sugar levels for longer if you&#39;re finding that this is becoming an increasing problem now serious side effects are rare and they happen in less than one in 10 000 people but you do need to seek urgent medical attention immediately if you get a general feeling of being unwell with severe tiredness fast or shallow breathing being cold and a slow heartbeat you should also seek urgent medical attention if the whites of your eyes turn yellow your skin turns yellow although this may be less obvious on darker skin because this can be a sign of liver problems as a side effect of the metformin there&#39;s also a risk of a serious life-threatening allergic reaction called anaphylaxis however thankfully this is very rare if you do develop swelling of the lip swelling of the tongue and finding it difficult to breathe you must seek urgent medical attention now these are not all of the side effects of metformin and for a full comprehensive list please do see the leaflet inside of your medicine packet or speak to your pharmacist if you have any further questions now let&#39;s briefly discuss the use of Metformin in pregnancy so it&#39;s generally thought that metformin is safe to take during pregnancy either alone or in combination with insulin if your doctor or Midwife says that your baby is healthy is generally thought to be saved to take Metformin whilst breastfeeding metformin passes into the breast milk in tiny amounts and it hasn&#39;t been linked to side effects in any breastfed babies however again if you do have any concerns any worries or questions it is best to speak to your doctor first before taking this or continuing to take it and if you are planning to get pregnant or if you are pregnant again speak to your health provider now what about taking metformin with other medicines or supplements well there are some medicines that can affect the way that metformin works if you&#39;re taking the following medicines your blood sugar levels may need to be checked more often and your dose changed now these are things such as steroid tablets things like prednisolone or hydrocortisone you also should speak to your doctor if you&#39;re taking tablets that make you pee more these are diuretics things like furosemide you should also speak to your doctor if you&#39;re taking medicines to treat heart problems and high blood pressure or hypertension male and female hormones such as testosterone estrogen or progesterone or other diabetes medicines your doctor may need to make a small change to your metformin dose if you&#39;ve just started contraceptive pills this is because contraceptive pills can change how your body handles sugar so that was a broad overview of Metformin including what it is what it&#39;s used for how to take it and possible side effects I do hope you enjoyed the video and learned something new and if you did please remember to like it leave me a comment if you&#39;ve got any thoughts or you&#39;d like to share your experiences of using Metformin please do subscribe to the channel for weekly medical education videos if you&#39;ve not done so already please also check out the references resources that I&#39;ve used to make this video These can be found in the description box and there&#39;s lots more useful information contained within these links and potentially some answers to questions you may have that weren&#39;t contained within this video finally I do have to stress that this has been designed as a general educational video not an individual clinical advice video for legal reasons please read the full disclaimer in the description box and if you do have specific individual questions about your own metformin dosing or levels please do see your own doctor as ever if you have any concerns questions or worries about your own health again and see your own health provider as ever thank you for watching and until next I was wondering whether drinking alcohol is really that bad for someone living with diabetes or whether having a drink or two at a party is actually okay so over the past couple months I tried the most popular alcoholic drinks and after each of them I tested my blood sugar to see if it spiked too high or dropped too low and what I discovered was the most important lesson about alcohol and diabetes that you will ever come across so in this video I&#39;m going to show you if it&#39;s okay to drink alcohol if you&#39;re someone living with diabetes how you can drink alcohol safely without doing too much damage to your body and what the best drink that will keep your butt sugar under control and by the way I&#39;m also going to share with you a story about a night when alcohol almost killed me please keep in mind I&#39;m not a doctor I&#39;m just sharing my experience as someone who&#39;s lived with diabetes for over 35 years the first alcoholic drink I decided to test was beer the reason why I chose beer was simple I come from the Czech Republic and Czechs are known to drink the most beer per capita in the world but is it okay to drink beer for a diabetic well the most iconic cck lugger beer doesn&#39;t have that much alcohol only 4.4% by volume but a small glass of this logger also has about 145 calories and 17 carbs which is quite a lot when I tested my blood sugar after drinking this beer I saw the glucose spiking to around 200 within 45 minutes of drinking it a lot higher than what I would like to see and that&#39;s why I don&#39;t think beer is the best option for people living with diabetes but the interesting thing is that the reason why most beers Spike blood sugar very fast is not the alcohol it&#39;s the high carb content of the beer so if you can&#39;t lift without it try looking for a more blood sugar friendly beer with less carbs Corona Premiere blood visor select or Miller Light might be good options look what my blood sugar did after I drank Corona Premiere the spike is very mild a lot less compared to a traditional beer unfortunately with all these light beers you need to compromise on on taste a little bit but at the end of the day it&#39;s up to you to decide what&#39;s more important whether it&#39;s the taste of the beer or your blood sugar levels now don&#39;t get me wrong I do drink a normal beer from time to time too whenever I do that I usually give myself a little bit of insulin before I start drinking that beer to cover those carbs in the beer and to avoid that blood sugar Spike and this approach works really well for me but another thing you need to keep in mind is that it&#39;s not only about the carbs the alcohol and the beer impact blood sugar too and I&#39;m going to show you how a bit later in this video next I want to talk about the second alcoholic drink I decided to test during my experiment wine now wine is the popular choice amongst many of my friends who live with diabetes because unlike beer wine tends to have a lower carbohydrate content but wine also has higher alcohol content by volume so is it really better than beer let&#39;s break it out an average wi you can buy in most stores and restaurants has somewhere between 11 and 14 % of alcohol but the range can get much wider with some fortified wines reaching the alcohol content of up to 20% now a typical glass of dry wine will have somewhere between 1 and 2 G of carbs which is very low almost negligible and about 100 to 130 calories when I tasted both white and red dry wine my blood sugar after drinking a glass didn&#39;t Spike at all even after the second glass the blood sugar was still flat for the next couple hours that&#39;s why I think that dry wine is really blood sugar friendly and it seems to be a good option for people living with diabetes but we have to keep in mind that not all wines are created equal a glass of sweet wine like dessert wine or sweet sparkling wine can easily have around 15 carbs and 160 calories that&#39;s about as much as a small beer here you can clearly see the difference between a glass of dry red wine and a glass of sweet sparkling wine my blood sugar spite close to 200 after drinking the sweet wine and that&#39;s not what I like to see so always make sure that you know what kind of wine you&#39;re drinking I try to stick to dry wines and not drink too much of it but how much is too much you might be asking okay let&#39;s talk about the elephant in the room I&#39;m sure that when you saw the title of this video the best alcohol for diabetes some of you were thinking well that&#39;s clear the best alcohol for diabetes is no alcohol so is it actually okay to drink alcohol well according to the American Diabetes Association drinking a moderate amount of alcohol regularly may have a positive impact on cardiovascular health and lower your hp1c they approve of one drink per day for women and two drinks per day for men so they seem to allow diabetics to drink daily but is that the right thing to do well I&#39;m not so sure see back in 2005 I was a young man living with type 1 diabetes I was using an insulin pump and I was supposed to prick my finger and check my blood sugar about 10 times per day but let me be honest with you what I really wanted to do back then was explore the world run after girls and go out and have drinks and it didn&#39;t take very long and I found my 21-year-old self at a party drinking beers and shots of whiskey one after another I probably drank like five beers and five shots of whiskey that night and I was having fun but the next thing I remember is an ambulance taking me to hospital I caus my myself an alcohol induced keto acidosis and I spent 36 hours uh in an ICU and to be honest with you I feel ashamed to this day when I think of that night I can hardly imagine the amount of anxiety and embarrassment that my parents must have been through now what I&#39;m trying to say with this story is we need to realize that alcohol plays an important social role in our society it&#39;s really hard to completely avoid it and not make any mistakes if you&#39;re not drinking any alcohol and it works for you it&#39;s perfectly okay I didn&#39;t make this video to encourage you to start drinking but if you do drink alcohol try to keep it in moderation don&#39;t go too crazy because I don&#39;t want you to have to go through what I had to go through on that night when I ended up in hospital now let&#39;s talk a bit more about the drink that played a major role in my previous story whiskey or you know what let&#39;s talk about spirits in general because when you live with diabetes it it doesn&#39;t really matter if you drink whiskey bourbon vodka gin or even tequila during my experiment I tried them all and I can confirm that they have very similar effects on both my blood sugar and the way I feel out of drinking them Spirits typically have around 40% alcohol biolume and slightly over 100 calories per shot so they&#39;re not really that helpful when you&#39;re trying to lose weight but at the same time they have zero carbohydrates you heard me right zero carbs I tested them all and my blood sugar stay pretty much flat after drinking them as long as I didn&#39;t mix them with other things so they might not be healthy but they are blood sugar friendly but most people like to include Spirits in cocktails and mixed drinks and that&#39;s why I decided to test a few of those to see what they will do to my blood sugar the most popular cocktail in the world is Margarita this drink is made of tequila lime juice and Triple sack which is a sweet orange flavored liquor an average Margarita has about 250 calories and 15 G of car and that&#39;s probably why my blood sugar spiked quickly beer and that&#39;s why my blood sugar spiked to over 400 I also drank way too much whiskey and alcohol in general which led to vomiting uh dehydration and caused a diabetic keto acidosis or dka since didn&#39;t tell you the whole story the thing is when we were drinking alcoholic beverages the initial blood sugar Spike caused by the carbohydrates in the drink is not the only thing we need to worry about there is one more thing that happens to our blood sugar several hours after we drink that alcohol a few years after my first alcohol incident I already knew I should not drink too much but I still enjoyed having a few drinks now and then one night I wanted to go play soccer with friends I didn&#39;t have enough time to eat dinner but I was already late so I didn&#39;t think too much of it releasing glucose to bring the blood sugar back to a safe Zone but when the liver is too busy with breaking down alcohol it doesn&#39;t have enough capacity to produce glucose and bring blood sugar up insulin resistance is a spectrum and so we can measure how insulin resistant anybody is at any moment you can measure me you can measure yourself you can measure your mom your sister your friend your colleague you can measure insulin resistance at any given moment when you&#39;re not insulin resistant you&#39;re called healthy when you get more insulin resistant you&#39;re called pre-diabetic and when you get really insulin resistant then you&#39;re called type 2 diabetic then you have have type 2 diabetes so insulin resistance and its spectrum is what underpins whether or not you have a diagnosis like pre-diabetes or type 2 diabetes so if you&#39;ve been diagnosed with insulin resistance well that means that you&#39;re somewhere in that Spectrum maybe you&#39;re getting a little bit close to pre-diabetes so insulin resistance moves you can become more or less insulin resistant depending on how you&#39;re living and the the objective is going to be to become less of it

presence of 20 Millar glucose however when the glucose concentrations are decreased is when interesting things start to happen at 10 millimolar human insulin and the basil insulin perfectly recreate the same binding Behavior as at 20 millimolar but for the nnc insulin there is a reduction in binding strength this trend continues at 5 3 and 0 Milla glucose in solution The Binding is 12.5 times weaker when glucose levels are at zero molar compared to at 20 molar exactly as theorized the team had produced the world&#39;s first insulin capable of understanding the world around it to see how this medicine behaved in the body the research team also ran some animal studies in diabetic animals they supplied them with a constant intravenous dose of glucose to simulate a meal they then added either normal insulin in one population or nnc in another population to simulate how a diabetic injects insulin to regulate their sugar levels they tuned the quantities of both glucose and Insulin so that the blood sugar levels were held constant then they stopped the glucose line simulating the end of a meal this caused immediately the glucose levels in both populations to plummet for the basil insulin population their blood glucose levels drop to a dangerous low similar to if a diabetic patient injects too much insulin and hit concentrations as low as three mamola hypoglycemia where researchers immediately stepped in to restart the glucose Supply to prevent damage to the animals for the nnc insulin glucose levels dropped rapidly but suddenly started to Plateau at around 4.5 Moler the nnc insulin had automatically deactivated itself preventing further glucose absorption and keeping glucose levels within a healthy tolerance despite nnc insulin continuing to be administered to put this in context this would mean that diabetics would never again have to worry about accidentally over or underdosing insulin they could administer confidently that if they got their numbers even slightly wrong the insulin would deactivate itself to keep them safe this like I said is the most advanced medicine I have ever seen and yes I am still biased and just to emphasize I have no Financial or otherwise connection to this work or output I just think it is Ultra Cool Science this rightfully has been echoed by several people as the culmination of thousands of years of Humanity&#39;s work to produce the best diabetic treatment possible I am incredibly proud of all the team members that have worked on this for so many years to bring this together the question might be what happens next another diabetes drug might have some unintended additional benefits for your brain metformin a safe and proven drug to treat Type 2 Diabetes by lowering blood sugar levels May potentially slow Aging in the body and brain but that&#39;s according to a recent study done on monkeys the jury still out on whether it has similar effects on humans up until this study out of China most of the evidence of metformin&#39;s anti-aging benefits were done on animals not closely related to humans like rodents the 40-month long research was conducted on adult male cous monkeys 40 months is roughly equal to 13 years of human life 12 older monkeys were given met Foreman while two control groups one of 16 older monkeys and 18 young to middle-age monkeys were not given the drug scientists conducted tests to create a model to estimate the monkeys expected and actual biological ages across different organs the metform monkeys showed signs of slower aging particularly in their livers and brains compared to the control group monkeys researchers estimate that metformin made the monkey&#39;s brain 6 years younger which could potentially translate to 18 years in humans researchers have already begun to work in partnership with MK on a phase 2 trial of metformin&#39;s anti-aging effects on 120 people

is it possible to cure typee 2 diabetes like what do you actually mean it means different things to different people we talk about reversing insulin resistance because it&#39;s the underlying cause of pre-diabetes and type 2 diabetes and it&#39;s the thing that makes your blood glucose wonky when it comes to reversing type 2 diabetes as an example what you want to do is drop your A1C value your A1C is basically like a thre Monon an indicator that tells you what your blood glucose stability has been over the course of 3 months the standard is to get your A1c to less than a 5.7% between 5.7 and 6.4 is considered pre-diabetes and then 6.5 and Beyond is considered type two in addition to that we also want to see a low fasting blood glucose and a low fasting insulin so low fasting blood glucose means less than 100 and low fasting insulin means less than five so if you can achieve all three of those then technically speaking you&#39;re in the safe Zone but what we want to see is that you maintain that not only you just get it today I want you to maintain that for a year then we can say that you&#39;ve reversed type 2 diabetes Al together

when you eat sugar and starch your blood sugar elevates your pancreas is asked to produce a hormone called insulin not to control the production of Sugar by your liver but now to force the liver to convert sugar into fat and as long as the the liver can very rapidly remove sugar from your bloodstream and turn it into fat you don&#39;t become diabetic however what happens to the systems in the liver is they become less and less sensitive to insulin and over time they become resistant to insulin and at first your pancreas can produce more insulin to force the liver to do its job but eventually it gets to a point where you cannot produce more insulin and the liver&#39;s resistance to that insulin is greater than the insulin you can produce and what happens then is slowly over time that Sugar builds up in the bloodstream at that point your body starts getting damaged your vascular system and every organ that gets provided with blood gets damaged by chronic excessive blood sugar

[Music] the nutritional attributes of avocados make them the perfect addition to your diabetes friendly diet unlike most varieties of fruits avocados are sugar-free and do not have a glycemic index value the glycemic index measures how much foods raise blood sugar knowing this about what you eat is a good way of managing your blood glucose remember values that are low are the way to go adding avocados to your diet is a major win to add flavor to your meal without raising your blood sugar avocados are also a good source of fiber fiber slows down food digestion preventing rapid rises in blood sugar following a meal talk about a feel-good feel full addition to your plate need an idea to get started throw a pizza party to celebrate your love for avocados go to love1today.com to find more nutritional information and tips on how to add avocados to your diabetes friendly menu

so fasting glucose levels is the main metric that we use to measure type two diabetes so if you&#39;re fasting glucose is underneath 100 milligram per deciliter you&#39;re considered healthy if it&#39;s between 100 and 120 you&#39;re considered pre-diabetic and if it&#39;s above 120 you&#39;re considered to have type 2 diabetes so when you&#39;re diagnosed with type 2 diabetes your main objective is to lower that fasting glucose level and it&#39;s very challenging but it&#39;s very important to help your long-term health and this hack very easily lowers that fasting glucose levels by 18 milligrams per deciliter in two months without counting calories without doing any crazy diets just by changing the order in which you eat your food

is there any such thing as good sugar no it&#39;s sucrose it&#39;s the same stuff and your body doesn&#39;t differentiate whether the sugar is in a fruit smoothie or the sugar is in a chocolate cake this is wild and all respect to glucose goddess but there are zero zero studies that show that fruit or fruit juice are harmful for humans and there are so many studies showing that things like watermelon juice or cherry juice or grape juice or orange juice improve lipid peroxidation improve the health of our blood vessels decrease DNA damage and improve glucose tolerance even things like honey are healthy for humans and this has been shown over and over and over in studies in diabetics giving them honey actually improves insulin sensitivity consume these Foods in the context of your life if you are not as active you&#39;re not going to need as many carbohydrates so what do I think humans should eat unprocessed Meats red meat chicken fish eggs raw milk unprocessed plant Foods primarily focus on fruit and vegetables and you will Thrive but you don&#39;t need to fear carbohydrates and you don&#39;t need to fear fruit and honey at all

I&#39;ll share a story that I heard from bernardet she&#39;s a mother of three in Albuquerque New Mexico in October of 23 bernardet was prescribed wovi for diabetes and a liver condition her insurance denied coverage of wovi three times bernardet wovi prescription would have cost about $1,000 after a $300 discount her doctor then prescribed OIC after two appeals Bernard&#39;s health insurance company approved her prescription even with health insurance Bernard&#39;s OIC prescription would have cost around $1,000 a month bernardet made the difficult decision to not pay $112,000 annually for either wovi or OIC both prescriptions prescribed by her doctors she now goes without

everyone in this video i will tell you about 12 of the best foods for diabetics so let&#39;s start with the number one that is whole grain the examples of whole grain include brown rice bulgur wheat buckwheat oats barley and quinoa whole grains are rich in fiber and nutrients as compared to the refined white grains fibers slow down the digestive process so whatever we eat is digested a bit slower thus the nutrients are absorbed by the body at a lower pace and does it prevents sudden spike in blood sugar level it will also keep you full for a longer duration whole grains have a lower glycemic index thus they have comparatively less impact on blood sugar levels now glycemic index means the amount of sugar that would be raised by a particular food so the foods that have lower glycemic index will raise your blood sugar to a lower extent whole grains in our diet instead of refined grains may reduce the risk of diabetes mellitus next is green leafy vegetables some examples of green leafy vegetables include spinach and kale so the green leafy vegetables are a rich source of nutrients and they are low in calories they are also low in digestible carbohydrates so the carbohydrates that are present in these are not easily absorbed by the body they are rich in dietary fibers phytochemicals and vitamins including the vitamin c and minerals this vitamin c has a potent antioxidant and anti-inflammatory property thus it helps reduce cellular damage and it also promotes heart health and eye health let&#39;s now go to nuts consuming nuts along with a controlled diet this can help in improving blood sugar level in type 2 diabetes patients these may also help reduce inflammation they also help lower blood sugar and hba1c so what is hba1c it is a marker for long term blood sugar control it also lowers ldl and ldl is the bad cholesterol the tree nuts that is walnut almond hazelnut and pistachios also help people with diabetes to improve their heart health for example pistachio contains glucagon like peptide and this reduces glucose levels thus it reduces the risk of diabetes next is greek yogurt greek yogurt is rich in protein calcium and probiotics it is low in carbohydrates one serving of greek yogurt contains only 6 to 8 grams of carbohydrate which is even lower than the conventional yogurt it has a special type of fat called conjugated linoleic acid and this may help keep you full for longer so just like fibers the cla or the conjugated linoleic acid also keeps you full for a longer duration so you will eat less and thus the blood sugar rise would be controlled it has a low glycemic index so they are again beneficial next is garlic garlic is rich in manganese vitamin b6 vitamin c selenium and fibers so consumption of garlic improves glycemic status garlic also helps lower blood sugar inflammation ldl cholesterol which as i have said is the bad cholesterol and blood pressure in people with diabetes next is cinnamon cinnamon enhances the release of insulin it also enhances signaling of insulin receptors thus it helps in the management of diabetes it is also a powerful antioxidant so it prevents the development of diabetes cinnamon also prevents a sudden rise in sugar level after meals so it is beneficial for patients with diabetes next is apple cider vinegar so apple cider vinegar is made by fermenting the apple juice so what happens here is that the sugar in the apple juice is converted to acetic acid so apart from acetic acid it also contains vitamin c and vitamin b the apple cider vinegar is also known to improve the function of insulin so it effectively reduces blood glucose levels next up is beans beans are rich in vitamin b minerals that is calcium magnesium and potassium it is also a rich source of fibers the fibers and the proteins keep us full for a longer duration and thus they will reduce our carbohydrate intake the beans also have a low glycemic index so glycemic index of a few beans for example soya bean is 15 kidney beans is 28 and chickpeas is around 33 so anything below 50 is considered as a low glycemic index so these are all beneficial next are berries so berries like blueberries strawberries are all powerful antioxidants they also contain polyphenols vitamin c and fibers so the polyphenol may improve insulin sensitivity in adults so this will help us lower the blood glucose level berries also have a low glycemic index next are eggs regular egg consumption may reduce your heart disease risk in several ways so the eggs may decrease inflammation they improve insulin sensitivity and they also help increase the hdl that is your good cholesterol levels hence they may reduce the risk of heart disease and diabetes a 2019 study found that eating a high fat low carbohydrate breakfast of eggs could help people with diabetes manage blood sugar levels throughout the day so the eggs promote good blood sugar management and they also promote eye health next is broccoli broccoli is one of the most nutritious vegetables and broccoli is low in calories and digestible carbs so it will help keep your blood sugar low it also has important nutrients like vitamin c and magnesium consuming broccoli sprouts may lead to a reduction in blood glucose in people with diabetes this reduction in blood glucose level is likely due to the sulforaphane this is a chemical which is found in cruciferous vegetables for example broccoli and sprouts the last one is fatty fish the examples of fatty fish include salmon herring sardines and mackerel and these are all rich source of omega-3 fatty acid dha and epa so the omega-3 fatty acid dha and epa these are all good for the health of heart the dha and epa specifically are important as they reduce inflammation thus they protect the cells that line your blood vessels and may help lower the risk of atherosclerosis so various researchers have indicated that eating fatty fish regularly may lower the risk of acute hi I&#39;m Dr Jason fun welcome to part three of the diabetes code Clinic where we&#39;re focused on type 2 diabetes remission we&#39;re trying to reverse the disease if you didn&#39;t have a chance to review Parts one and two you can go back and have a look where we talked about what type 2 diabetes is and also an introduction to low carbohydrate diets today we&#39;re going to continue talking about low carbohydrate diets [Music] remember that the disease of type 2 diabetes is your body having too much glucose which is a type of sugar imagine a barrel where you can put water in the water&#39;s like that glucose and the barrels like your body it can store a certain amount of this glucose but when it&#39;s full it&#39;s going to spill over when it spills over you see it in the blood when you see the high blood glucose you get tired diagnosed with type 2 diabetes and where did that glucose come from it came from your diet so you got to look for the sources of sugar in your diet and get rid of it that&#39;s why low carbohydrate diets can be so effective the key Point here is that some foods are going to raise your blood glucose and some foods don&#39;t raise your blood glucose so you want to emphasize those foods that don&#39;t raise your blood glucose ose and that&#39;s done by cutting down your carbohydrates but what foods are high and what foods are low you can certainly test it yourself using a blood glucose monitor but you can also go to something called the glycemic index which has been used for decades and what the glycemic index is is a scale of how much a certain food on average is going to raise your blood glucose and it&#39;s a scale of 0 to 100 100 being uh glucose which is the most that your blood glucose goes up in response to that food so zero is uh good 100 means that that food tends to maximum raise your blood glucose and this is done by measuring a whole lot of people and taking the average response but your own response may be different which is why it may be useful to personalize it there&#39;s something else called the glycemic load which is also a very very useful concept because it takes into account both the glycemic index and how much a typical portion of food is because certain foods may have a very high glycemic index but a relatively low glycemic load because the typical portion just isn&#39;t that big for example carrots have a fairly high glycemic index of 70 but the glycemic load is relatively low at four and this is why it&#39;s important to take both of them into account and you can find these lists on the internet they&#39;re fairly easy and they&#39;re well accepted by anyone so if we look at this glycemic index of foods and you can look at these foods like chicken and butter and eggs and beef and you&#39;ll notice those are mostly proteins and fats and therefore if you look at the gemic index it&#39;s zero when you test large numbers of people no matter how much chicken you eat or eggs or butter the blood glucose on average goes up zero that&#39;s great so if you&#39;re eating a meal and you prioritize those Foods your blood glucose is not expected to go up at all and that&#39;s because it&#39;s really just carbohydrate containing foods that are going to raise your blood glucose because carbohydrates are sugar you eat the sugar your blood sugar goes up of the carbohydrates there&#39;s still a very big difference between refined carbohydrates and natural carbohydrates those are the things that look like they do in nature so refined carbohydrates might be things such as Corn Flakes baguettes and so on a baguette doesn&#39;t grow on a tree it doesn&#39;t grow on the ground it has to be refined and when you refine these carbohydrates the glycemic index tends to be very high and the glycemic load tends to be very high because a lot of the refining makes it easier to digest and also tends to get rid of a lot of the fiber the proteins and the fats leaving a relatively concentrated pure form of carbohydrate therefore when you eat it the uh body can absorb it very quickly and you get this big spike of glucose if you look at the glycemia index of a cornflakes is very high at 85 and the baguette still very high at 95 and the glycemic load which takes into account the portion size is still very high around 45 to 55 now contrast them to Natural carbohydrates because people point out that for example cauliflowers and carrots they&#39;re also carbohydrates and absolutely they are when you look at the carrot it glycemic index might be very high 70 to 85 if it&#39;s cooked is a little bit higher but the glycemic load is down at four cauliflower has a low glycemic index of only 15 and even lower when you get to glycemic load of only 0.8 even foods that grow below the ground things such as sweet potatoes and beets which are starchy carbohydrates but they&#39;re natural have a relatively high glycemic index 65 to 70 but again when you compare it to the glycemic load you see that the glycemic load is much lower it&#39;s down at 11 and S compared to White rise which is has a glycemic load of 56 or a baguette which is 45 so natural carbohydrates and refined carbohydrates there is a big difference cutting down total carbohydrates certainly is effective but if you do have to eat some choose the natural whole unprocessed carbohydrate because it makes a big difference and it&#39;s not just me saying that you can see this uh American Heart Association scientific statement which is just from 2022 and what they tell you less diabetes medication well that&#39;s great why wouldn&#39;t Everybody follow this very low carbohydrate diet the American Diabetes Association in 2020 uh published their consensus guidelines for Nutrition Therapy and what they said is that reducing overall carbohydrate intake for individuals with diabetes has demonstrated the most evidence for improving glycemia which means that no these are you know what fascinates me most about diabetes it is not actually about genetics like we have been told after working with thousands of diabetes patients I have discovered something that is going to change everything you thought you knew about blood sugar control let me share something personal I remember watching my grandmother meticulously counting her carbs measuring her portions yet still struggling with her blooder like many of you she believed diabetes was her Destiny because it runs in the family but here&#39;s the shocking truth type 2 diabetes isn&#39;t a genetic sentence it is largely about how our modern food environment has betrayed us think about insulin as a key that unlocks your cells to let glucose in when you are constantly flooding your body with carbs and sugar it is like making hundreds of copies of that key eventually your cells just stop responding that is insulin resistance but here&#39;s the exciting part you can actually reverse this process you know what is really mindblowing your body does not actually need carbohydrates to survive I know shocking right we have essential amino acids and essential fatty acids but there is no such thing as essential carbohydrate your body can make all the glucose it needs through a process called glucon neogenesis let me take you into your kitchen for a moment those healthy whole grain crackers in your pantry they&#39;re actually packing 10% more carbs than what is listed on the label and that diabetic friendly breakfast cereal forget it it might be spiking your blood sugar more than a table sugar this is why I&#39;m so excited about combining smart food choices with proper supplementation many of my patients have found remarkable success using like our sugar MD Advanced glucose support alongside the dietary changes it is like giving your body an extra tool to help maintain healthy blood sugar levels at all times but before we dive deeper into Solutions let&#39;s understand what happens when you eat different types of foods when you eat carbohydrates for example your blood sugar and Insulin Spike dramatically with protein there is a much smaller rice but with fat almost nothing happens especially with healthy fats it&#39;s like a flatline on your graph on your CGM here&#39;s some gamechanging food hacks for you for diabetes control speaking of food let me share something fascinating about pasta that changed everything for my patients you know how Italians seem to eat pasta all the time and yet they have lower diabetes rates than the US it is all in how they prepare it they use high fiber varieties they add olive oil and here&#39;s the key they never overcook that elante texture actually lowers it his glycemic index but here&#39;s even more incredible hack freezing your bread or pasta can actually make it better for your blood sugar right sounds crazy well when you freeze bread or pasta and th it properly the starch molecules restructure in a way that makes them harder for your body to break down one of my patients who combined this technique with the advanced glucose support saw remark able improvements in her postmeal BL sugar spikes let&#39;s talk about beverages for a moment this is where most people get tripped up the 12 oz can of cola you&#39;re having with lunch it is picking 40 gram of carbs that is more than many diabetics should have in any meal don&#39;t even get me started on those fancy coffee drinks a 16 oz caramel macchiato has about 60 gr of carbs that&#39;s like eating four slices of bread here&#39;s what I recommend to my patients start your day with water and lemon maybe some black coffee with heavy cream take your Advanced glucose support supplement and if you need something sweet later try my special sweet potato hack this is fascinating if you boil a sweet potato for 30 minutes instead of 8 minutes it is glycemic index drops from 61 down to 46 science is amazing isn&#39;t it now let&#39;s talk about exercise and blood sugar because this is where most people get it wrong you might think intense exercise is better but gentle movement is actually more effective for managing diabetes when you exercise intensely your body releases stress hormones that can raise your blood sugar but a gentle 10-minute walk after every meal well that&#39;s perfect for helping your muscles use up that excess glucose now is plat based Whole Food beneficial for patients with diabetes I am Dr Jerry tan I&#39;m AO Clinic trained endocrinologist in this randomized control trial involving 169 adults with type two diabetes randomized to an intensive Whole Food plant-based intervention with moderate exercise or standard medical care for 24 weeks clearly the study show that whole food plant-based with moderate exercise intervention was more effective for improving glycemic control lowering A1C than standard medical care reduce the need for diabetes and cardiovascular medications which is a plus and even inducing diabetes remission in some participants in short this study proves that a whole food plant-based intervention is a highly effective evidence-based approach for our patients with type 2 diabetes

Hello guys! How are you? That diabetes is an extremely dangerous disease you already know! I&#39;ve explained in several videos about the evils of poorly controlled diabetes; that glycated hemoglobin above 7 can already be harmful to your body and that you can forget your mother&#39;s name, your father&#39;s name, your home address, but if you are diabetic you have to know the value of your glycated hemoglobin ! Glycated hemoglobin estimates how much your average blood glucose has been in the last 90 days. Therefore, it is important for you to know if it is well controlled, because it will define whether your vessels, your kidneys and especially your heart are getting sick or not. Aglycated hemoglobin values ​​above 9 are terrible; lead to leg amputation, loss of sensation in arms and legs, greatly increase the risk of heart attack and stroke! So how do you manage your diabetes? How to keep your glycated hemoglobin below 7? What foods do you, who are diabetics, have to eat all the time, that are nutritious and that will help you control your glucose, do you know? If you don&#39;t know, today I&#39;m going to show you 10 essential foods and that if you who are diabetic start eating routinely, your glycated hemoglobin will improve a lot, that is, your diabetes will improve a lot. So, come with me until the end of the video and... Run the vignette! Dr. Roberto Yano, Cardiologist. Hello, friends of the heart! How are you? I am Doctor Roberto Yano, Cardiologist and Pacemaker Specialist. Today I&#39;m going to show you 10 essential foods that you who are diabetic should consume in your daily life to keep your glucose always well controlled. And for you who are not diabetic, these foods are also very important because they will prevent you from becoming diabetic one day! But first, I&#39;m going to ask you to share the video, ok? Mainly for your father, your diabetic mother, or a diabetic that you like a lot; show him this video! A change in diet can save that person&#39;s life! Without further ado, let&#39;s go to the 10 foods? Food number 1, there&#39;s no excuse for you not to eat it... It&#39;s the egg. The egg is a complete food, it is rich in minerals, proteins; and, unlike what many imagine, consuming eggs in moderation will not increase your cholesterol, ok? So stay calm! In addition, the egg has a low amount of glucose, but is rich in minerals and antioxidant agents. So, don&#39;t forget to introduce the egg in your diet, ok? Food number 2: oats. Oatmeal is a carbohydrate, but why does it help control diabetes? Oats are extremely high in fiber; the fibers form as if it were a mesh that prevent the rapid absorption of glucose! And oatmeal can be used in any meal, whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner. You can use oatmeal easily and in any food, just have a little creativity! Once again I repeat: because it is a source of carbohydrate, it has to be eaten in moderation, ok! No exaggeration! But let&#39;s go! Food number 3: the avocado. I always talk about the avocado! In addition to being a delicious fruit, it is extremely nutritious! Your fat is one of the healthiest fats out there! Especially for our hearts! Because it is a food rich in fat, it makes the absorption of glucose occur more gradually, slower, avoiding insulin spikes, and better controlling your glucose! And, it is worth saying, the avocado is wonderful, it is delicious! You can use it in juice, salad, even as a seasoning you can use it! It works for everything! So make avocado one of your favorite fruits! Fourth food: fish. Fish like tuna, sardines and salmon are rich in anti-inflammatory foods, rich in good fats, fats that protect the heart! So, you see that not all fat is bad? On the contrary, there are many types of fats that are essential and fundamental for our heart! For you to consume correctly, you need to know what they are! Look how many good fat options I gave you just in this video! Just for that I already deserve your like, don&#39;t you? So, leave your like! Don&#39;t forget, leave a like! Well, the fifth food is chia. Chia has a combination of several elements that will help the diabetic. First, it has a great power of satiety. A little you consume makes you satisfied! Another thing is that it is rich in fiber, which helps to make glucose be absorbed more slowly; it also has excellent fat, which I have already explained above. It will help to reduce the speed of absorption of sugar, carbohydrates! It is important to talk about this issue of satiety too, because the diabetic is exactly that patient who is the most hungry! Imagine that, the diabetic&#39;s blood is full of sugar, but his cells that needed to have more sugar, are low on sugar; this makes the body understand that your body is always lacking sugar and the diabetic is excessively hungry. So chia will help with satiety! So, always have chia at home, ok? Sixth food: legumes. Legumes like beans, peas and lentils are excellent sources of fiber and will help with glycemic control. In addition, legumes in general are rich in vitamins, minerals and proteins that are essential for our health and for maintaining good control of our blood glucose; besides being delicious, of course! Come on! Seventh food: red fruits. Most berries like strawberries, blueberries and raspberries are low carb! In addition, these fruits have excellent antioxidant power and are rich in fiber! Knowing that the diabetic lives a little inflamed, anti-inflammatory foods will be essential for the good control of our glucose! In fact, I talk more about anti-inflammatory foods in this video that I&#39;ll leave on the card. If you haven&#39;t seen it yet, I&#39;m sure it will be worth it! Eighth food; this food is not lacking at home: it is extra virgin olive oil! Extra virgin olive oil also has excellent anti-inflammatory power! In addition to being one of the best fats for the heart because it reduces LDL cholesterol, which is bad cholesterol, increases HDL cholesterol, which is good cholesterol and, as it is a fat, it also slows down the absorption of sugar by our intestines! But, like any fat, it has to be eaten in moderation, because all fat, no matter how healthy, does make you fat! So consume, but in moderation! Come on! Ninth food. But first, have you already subscribed to the channel? Have you clicked the bell to receive all notifications? Have you already liked this video and all my videos that you liked? Oh good! Fortunately! If you&#39;ve done all this, I&#39;m glad! But if you haven&#39;t already, no problem! After the video you subscribe and click the bell, ok? But, coming back, ninth food: dark green leaves. Leaves like broccoli, kale, spinach and arugula are rich in fiber, minerals and antioxidant elements! For sure, you diabetic and non-diabetic, you have to include these leaves in your day to day routine! These foods are essential for your heart health! As I always say, everything that comes straight from nature is much healthier and much more nutritious than stuffing yourself with processed foods, full of trans fats, full of empty calories. Feeding from nature will definitely protect your heart! And, tenth and final food to lower your blood sugar, what is it? It&#39;s the oilseeds! They shouldn&#39;t be missing from mine and your diet! So, consume walnuts, chestnuts, macadamia nuts, pistachios and hazelnuts. In addition to being one of the main sources of good fats, oilseeds are also anti-inflammatory foods, reduce oxidative stress, help reduce insulin resistance and have high satiety power! They are more expensive, but the little you consume, a little bit a day, will definitely help your diabetes! Look, guys, how much good food, even for you who have diabetes, for you who have pre-diabetes, now there&#39;s no excuse! You already know what you have to eat, just apply! Be better than your biggest excuse! Change your habits, practice quality of life, practice health, take care of your body and your health! Here I mentioned just a few foods, but there are many others that diabetics can use! If you liked the subject, leave it here in the comments below; if it has a good engagement, I&#39;ll do the second part of this video! And, of course, whenever possible, look for a good Nutritionist to help you use all these foods in the correct amounts, so you can get the best possible result! If you have any questions, you can also leave them here in the comments! Although I can&#39;t answer everyone, it helps me a lot to come up with new ideas to produce new videos! So, comment below what you think or if you have any questions! OK people! So, today&#39;s message is this! A big hug and until next time!

diabetes a chronic condition characterized by high blood sugar levels affects Millions worldwide while there is no definitive cure several scientifically proven methods can effectively manage and even reverse the condition here are the top 10 one weight loss for individuals with type 2 diabetes losing even a small amount of weight can significantly improve blood sugar control studies show that losing 5 to 10% of body weight can lead to remission in some cases this is because excess weight puts additional strain on the pancreas making it difficult to produce enough insulin by shedding pounds you reduce this burden and improve insulin sensitivity example a person with type 2 diabetes weighing 200 lb could experience significant Improvement by losing just 10 to 20 lb this could trans translate to lower blood sugar levels reduced medication requirements and even complete remission in some cases two healthy eating adopting a healthy diet is crucial for managing and reversing diabetes this involves focusing on whole unprocessed foods rich in fiber vitamins and minerals limiting processed foods sugary drinks and unhealthy fats is essential a balanced diet helps regulate blood sugar levels and improves overall health example a diabetic individual could switch s from white bread and sugary cereals to whole wheat bread and oatmeal for breakfast they could also replace sugary snacks with fruits and vegetables and opt for lean protein sources like fish and chicken instead of processed Meats three regular exercise physical activity plays a vital role in managing diabetes exercise increases insulin sensitivity allowing your body to use glucose more effectively aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate intensity exercise or 75 minutes of vigorous intensity exercise per week example a diabetic individual could incorporate brisk walking swimming or biking into their daily routine they could also participate in team sports or Fitness classes for added motivation and enjoyment four medication in some cases medication may be necessary to manage diabetes effectively several types of medications are available each with its own mechanism of action your doctor will work with you to determine the best medication based on your individual needs example metformin is a commonly prescribed medication for type 2 diabetes it helps improve insulin sensitivity and reduce glucose production in the liver five insulin therapy for individuals with type 1 diabetes or those with type 2 diabetes who no longer produce enough insulin insulin therapy is essential this involves injecting insulin to regulate blood sugar levels different types of insulin are available and your doctor will determine the appropriate regimen for you example a person with type 1 diabetes may need to inject insulin multiple times a day to maintain normal blood sugar levels six continuous glucose monitoring CGM CGM devices provide real-time data on blood sugar levels allowing individuals to make informed decisions about food exercise and medication this continuous monitoring helps identify Trends and patterns enabling better diabetes management example a CGM device can alert a diabetic individual when their blood sugar levels are too high or too low allowing them to take corrective action promptly seven blood sugar monitoring regular blood sugar monitoring is crucial for managing diabetes this involves using a glucometer to check blood sugar levels at home the frequency of monitoring will vary depending on individual needs and treatment plans example a diabetic individual on insulin therapy may need to check their blood sugar levels several times a day while those on oral medications May check less frequently eight Stress Management stress can significantly impact blood sugar levels finding healthy ways to manage stress such as yoga meditation or spending time in nature can help improve diabetes control example a diabetic individual could practice deep breathing exercises or mindfulness meditation to reduce stress levels nine sleep getting enough sleep is essential for overall health including diabetes management aim for 7 to8 hours of quality sleep each night example a diabetic individual could establish a regular sleep schedule create a relaxing bedtime routine and avoid screen time before bed to improve Sleep Quality 10 support system having a strong support system of family friends and Health Care Professionals can be invaluable in managing diabetes this support network can provide emotional encouragement practical assistance and valuable insights example a diabetic individual could join a diabetes support group or connect with a diabetes educator for guidance and motivation remember reversing diabetes is a journey not a destination by consistently implementing these strategies and working closely with your Healthcare team you can effectively manage your condition and improve your overall health and well-being Mega tips delving deeper into reversing diabetes while the top 10 strategies provide a solid foundation for managing and reversing diabetes let&#39;s explore some additional aspects to consider one individualized approach it&#39;s crucial to remember that diabetes management is highly individualized what works for one person may not work for another therefore collaborating with your Healthcare team to develop a personalized plan tailored to your specific needs and preferences is essential two dietary modifications Beyond simply focusing on Whole Foods specific dietary adjustments can further enhance blood sugar control these include limiting refined carbohydrates opt for whole grains instead of white bread pasta and rice choosing healthy fats include sources like avocados nuts and olive oil in your diet increasing fiber intake fiber slows down the absorption of sugar into the bloodstream reducing sugary drinks replace sugary beverages with water unsweetened tea or black coffee three xiety incorporating various types of exercise into your routine can keep you engaged and motivated consider activities like cardio brisk walking running swimming cycling strength training building muscle mass improves insulin sensitivity yoga or Pilates these practices enhance flexibility and balance while reducing stress for psychological support living with diabetes can be emotionally challenging seeking support from a therapist or counselor can help you cope with theot aspects of the condition five technology and diabetes management several technological advancements can Aid in diabetes management including diabetes apps these apps help track blood sugar levels food intake and exercise smart insulin pens these devices record insulin Doses and provide reminders artificial pancreas systems these systems automatically adjust insulin delivery based on blood sugar readings six ongoing monitoring and adjustments regular check ups with your Healthcare team are crucial to monitor your progress and adjust your treatment plan as needed this may involve adjusting medication dosages modifying your diet or exercise routine or incorporating new technologies seven long-term commitment reversing diabetes requires a long-term commitment to Lifestyle Changes and ongoing management while the journey may have its challenges the potential rewards of improved health and well-being are significant but number eight celebrating successes it&#39;s important to acknowledge and celebrate your successes along the way whether it&#39;s losing weight achieving better blood sugar control or simply feeling more energetic recognizing your progress can help you stay motivated and on track nine seeking support and inspiration connect with others who have successfully reversed diabetes their stories and experiences can provide valuable insights and encouragement 10 embracing a positive mindset maintaining a positive attitude and focusing on the potential for improvement can significantly impact your journey believe in your ability to manage your condition and live a healthy fulfilling life remember reversing diabetes is an ongoing process that requires dedication and effort by working closely with your Healthcare team implementing lifestyle changes and embracing a positive mindset you can achieve significant improvements in your health and well-being [Music]

Having very high sugar and a lot of insulin in the blood can cause nail fungus, skin candidiasis, warts, spots or darker skin on our neck, armpit, and even make our skin drier and very itchy. But how do you know that this is due to diabetes? And if it is, how do you know if you are in an early stage or if you already have a more advanced disease? Hello everyone, I am Dr. Veller, a doctor with three specialties Family Health , Internal Medicine and Nephrology and with my knowledge and experience I want to help you detect this disease early so that you can combat it. In a few minutes I am going to reveal to you the seven most important symptoms that do appear on your skin that may indicate that you have diabetes, prediabetes or very high insulin. But I also want to warn you. Many of the spots or wounds that I am going to show you indicate diabetes in its earliest stages . But there are three injuries that are more dangerous and I want you to look at them very carefully, since in those cases the problem is not really in the skin. They hide much more serious complications in your internal organs such as the kidney, heart or your circulation and in your eyes. And today I am going to reveal them to you. Without further ado, number one, excess sugar in your blood causes fungus to appear on your nails or in the region of folds in your skin such as the groin or between the rolls of the belly. And here we are talking about two types of fungi: onychomycosis and candida fungus infection. Onychomycosis is very common. They can appear on your toenails or fingernails. Many of my patients discovered that they were diabetic because these fungi were never cured. And what happens is that in order to completely eliminate them, you have to control your blood sugar. Now, if you have redness or very itchy spots between your belly rolls, in your groin, in your armpit, or elsewhere on your skin, you may have yeast infection. Also a common complication in patients with diabetes. Many times they even appear in the genital region. The good news is that this has treatment. It doesn&#39;t matter how old you are or what stage of diabetes you are in. In many cases, this shows diabetes in early stages when we are still able to reverse it. Number two And many do not know this, having very high blood sugar and especially a lot of insulin, causes warts to appear on your neck and armpit. These warts may have a peculiarity: they may be darker, as if they were small moles that rise above your skin. These are known as Acrochordons. They are harmless, small benign tumors that do not cause symptoms. Having one or two in some part of your body may be normal, but if you have many grouped together, especially in those regions of the body, it may be because your insulin is very high or even because you already have diabetes, especially type two diabetes. And what happens is that before your sugar gets too high, your pancreas works hard to keep it at normal levels and to do this it has to secrete more and more insulin. The problem is that this is a double-edged sword. Insulin, although it lowers your blood sugar, also acts as if it were a growth hormone. It makes these warts grow, in addition to obviously making you accumulate visceral fat, stimulating obesity and slowing down your metabolism. Now not everything has to be bad news. If you noticed that you are getting these small tumors, you may have prediabetes or diabetes in very early stages and if you detect it in time you will be able to completely reverse it. On the other hand, if you have already suffered from diabetes for a long time, you may need to control it better by adjusting your remedies. And here I want to clarify a question that you always ask me: Is there a cure for diabetes? Can it be reversed? And what does early stage diabetes mean? Well, the answer is yes. We can reverse diabetes, but of course, it all depends on what stage it is. In the first years the main problem is having very high sugar in your blood, but there are still no chronic or irreversible complications, such as damage to your eyes, damage to your kidney or your circulation. If we grab it here, it&#39;s much easier to reverse. This is what we know such as early stage diabetes. Now, when the sugar circulating in your blood is very high and for many years, complications begin to appear. For example, loss of sight due to damage to your retina, kidney problems. This organ begins to filter your blood less and also problems with your circulation and your heart. But I tell you something, in some cases, even in these stages, it is possible to reverse it or at least control it completely and above all, prevent the damage from continuing to advance and be very attentive, because three of the symptoms that I am going to show you in Your skin may indicate that you already have some of these complications in a hidden way without you knowing it. Continuing with symptom number three that deceives us all. Very dry and very itchy skin. Very high blood sugar can cause this, especially on the forearm, thigh, buttocks, but it can occur anywhere on your body, including your hands, between your fingers, and on the bottoms of your feet. feet. But how do we know if this is caused by diabetes or because our skin is just like that? Well, it&#39;s one thing to have dry skin for a long time, even since when we were children or teenagers, or we were always allergic. Another thing is that once we are an adult, these injuries have appeared and, above all, they are getting worse. Even though we are using moisturizers and different remedies that the doctor gave us.
