Leg cramps at night, restless legs or tingling. Nightmares and vivid dreams. Diabetes can manifest itself in the most varied ways. There are very common symptoms that appear at night that indicate that you may have early-stage diabetes and not know it. Despite what I am going to tell you, today we know that diabetes is treatable and in many cases it is possible to reverse it. Or if you are using several medications, including insulin, it is possible to reduce their dose and amount. That is why today I am going to reveal to you the seven warning signs of diabetes that appear at night and that if you identify them, it is better that you get a check-up to detect it as soon as possible and treat it. And stay until the end because I am also going to show you three very powerful natural remedies that you surely have in your kitchen to help you control blood glucose levels and combat this disease naturally. A lot of attention. This is the first symptom that usually appears in people with diabetes at night. It&#39;s called nocturia, that is, urinating a lot at night. It is very important and I am going to tell you a personal experience. A 58-year-old relative asked me one day why he might be urinating so many times at night. He told me that he was getting up four or five times and couldn&#39;t sleep. The first thing I asked him is if he was drinking a lot of water before going to bed or coffee mate or some tea with a diuretic effect after seven or eight at night or if he had a prostate problem. The answer was no, there was no apparent cause. Then I asked him to measure his glucose on an empty stomach in the morning and it gave him 250, meaning he had diabetes. He began treatment taking metformin and at the same time making changes in habits, improvements in diet, consuming more anti-inflammatory foods, doing physical exercise, even lifting weights. In less than a year he was able to stop metformin and today his glucose is always below 120. And here I want to make two messages clear to you. First, getting up to urinate at night can be normal as long as it happens only once or twice if you are more than 70 years older than this or if it repeatedly interrupts your sleep, you should think that something is wrong. In most cases, this symptom is caused by bad habits that we have or by some benign condition. But if you&#39;ve never had a checkup, it&#39;s better to check your blood glucose because it can indicate diabetes. Second, we don&#39;t stop exercising because we get old. On the contrary, we become old because we stop exercising. Many will say that this is very difficult and that it is not possible, especially after 50 years of age. But the science today is very clear. Doing muscle hypertrophy and strength exercises even after this age can rejuvenate us by ten years or more. And no matter how old you are, this can cause you to even reduce the amount of remedies you are taking. Second sign you should pay attention to: Blurred vision at night. Sudden changes in blood glucose can affect your vision and in many cases it manifests itself in this way mainly when it is getting dark and it is darker. I have patients who tell me that they have stopped driving in the afternoon or at night precisely because of this problem. Or some people, for example, who get up at night, either to go to the bathroom or to drink water, and experience very blurred vision, much more intense than during the day. In this case, in addition to consulting with your eye doctor, get a check-up. It can be a symptom of diabetes in the early stages and this has treatment. In fact, if the blurred vision is really caused because you have very high blood glucose when you start treatment and modify your habits, your diet, in less than a week, this symptom improves. Number three, excessive thirst. When glucose is very high in the blood, especially above 200, it has a diuretic effect. It makes you urinate more. During the day you may not feel thirsty because you have access to water, you urinate a lot and recover that fluid by drinking water, but at night, as you continue to produce urine, you become dehydrated and wake up with that feeling of dry mouth. Very thirsty at night. It is very common for these people to go to sleep already with the water bottle next to the bed and many times when you don&#39;t wake up because of thirst, you notice it. When you wake up, your mouth is very dry or you develop canker sores, very painful mouth sores, even bad breath and dental problems such as cavities. This problem of being very thirsty is called polydipsia. One of the first symptoms that people with diabetes notice. Number four and this can be very annoying. Leg cramps with very intense pain, either in the calf or the soles of the feet that wakes the person in the middle of the night. This can occur due to various diabetes-related problems. First, dehydration caused by high blood glucose levels. Second, circulation problems, which causes a decrease in the delivery of oxygen and nutrients to the muscles of your legs. Third, fluctuation in blood glucose levels, which can cause alterations in potassium, sodium, calcium and magnesium in your blood, which ends up causing cramps or can be caused by neuropathy. That is, diabetes has already advanced a little further. and it&#39;s damaging your peripheral nerves. At this point I want to remind you that you are not alone. Diabetes affects thousands of people and today there are very effective treatments. But not only that, we are seeing more and more patients reverting to diabetes, especially when it is caught in the early stages and those who already have more advanced diabetes. There is also a lot to do to improve the quality of life. I&#39;m going to tell you some tips on natural remedies that can help you a lot. And here this has to be very clear. To treat diabetes you do not have to diet, this is not what it is about. A diet has a start and end date. What you have to do is forever change the way you look at food. The way we eat a meal should not only provide us with calories, it must provide us with nutrients, active ingredients and they must act in our body as true natural remedies. Eating well is not expensive, despite what many believe, it becomes expensive when they complicate things. We have to be able to take advantage of the nutrients and medicinal properties of common foods. As I&#39;m going to tell you, symptom number five: nightmares and night terrors. A patient&#39;s wife told me the other day that she couldn&#39;t sleep because her husband would get up at night or scream because of the nightmares he was having. What is happening? Changes in the brain chemistry of these patients, including very high glucose, can alter the release of neurotransmitters such as serotonin, which are chemical messengers we have in the brain. This, added to the stress and anxiety of these people, plus the sleep disruption they may experience from getting up at night to urinate or drink water, and the changes in perception they may suffer due to very high blood glucose levels, can lead to have disturbing dreams. Now, not all people with diabetes experience this. It can be caused by other medical conditions, but if it becomes a new-onset symptom in your life, get checked, including testing your blood glucose levels. Number six Restless legs syndrome and nocturnal tingling is very common during the day. You may not feel anything, but you go to bed at night to rest and it&#39;s like you can&#39;t find a comfortable position for your legs or you have that intense need to constantly move them . This can be caused by various reasons in diabetes, alterations in blood circulation, very high blood glucose levels that alter the function of your nerves or imbalance in the levels of iron and other minerals in your blood that can cause this sensation in your limbs. In other cases it does not manifest as restless legs, but as numbness or tingling, annoying, often painful in your feet. This can be caused by diabetes in the early stages, but at the same time it can also be caused by diabetes that is already a little more advanced, where there are complications such as neuropathy. So it is very important that you get a check-up. Number Seven Sleep Apnea This is a dangerous condition in which the patient stops breathing for a few seconds during the night. At that moment, as there is a respiratory pause, the oxygen levels in your blood fall to dangerously low levels and suddenly the person begins. It&#39;s like breathing is activated again and you start breathing sharply. This person is generally not aware of the problem because he or she does not wake up. The one who notices it is the person who sleeps with him. But even if the patient does not wake up, his sleep is not restful and the next day he is very tired, fatigued or falling asleep during the day. This may indicate that you have sleep apnea. While this condition is not directly caused by diabetes, an association is known to exist. Up to 50% of people with diabetes may have apnea. Therefore, since this association exists, it is important that if you have any of these problems, look for the other one. Now I am going to tell you three foods that work as natural remedies against diabetes and can control your blood glucose levels, on an empty stomach and also at night. Consume any or all of these for three or four weeks. And then tell me how it went. Get checked again so you can see the results first. Organic apple cider vinegar with mother. There are many studies that show that adding 10 to 15 milliliters or a tablespoon to your carbohydrate-rich foods such as beans, lentils, rice or even any meal, decreases high blood glucose spikes after eating. Vinegar is a true natural remedy. It makes you lose weight, improves your metabolism, makes you eat less because it generates a satiety or full stomach effect and is also a powerful natural medicine against diabetes. Another way to use it is to dilute 10 to 15 milliliters or a tablespoon in a glass of water. It can be cold or warm as you like and you take this on an empty stomach and before lunch and dinner. Be careful, do not drink pure vinegar because it can damage the mucosa and mouth, the enamel of your teeth and cause burns to the esophagus. If you don&#39;t get the organic vinegar with the mother. Use the vinegar you have available, since the active ingredient is the acetic acid present. Also in other types of vinegar. Second natural remedy, pomegranate, a fruit with ancient medicinal properties, but today we see all its benefits. The ideal dose that was made in scientific studies is a glass of 200 or 250 milliliters of pomegranate juice every day for 3 to 4 weeks. But we know that this fruit is difficult to get in some places. So you can consume it at least two to three times a week. You will also have enormous benefits. To prepare its juice, you can use the seeds of a whole fruit, put it in a blender with 200 to 250 milliliters of water and then drink its unfiltered juice. Or you can eat its seeds directly with a spoon directly from the fruit and even prepare an infusion from its peel. In our book The Superpower of Food, we tell you all this in much more detail. Third natural remedy beet or beet juice. You can take it every day and it has spectacular effects, especially when combined with physical exercise, running, swimming, cycling and even doing strength and resistance exercises, since it improves your circulation, it can reduce all these annoying symptoms that I told you about before. , such as cramps, tingling and numbness, and even improves the delivery of oxygen to your muscles. Taking it every day reduces inflammation, improves insulin resistance and controls blood glucose levels. And if that were not enough, it also serves to control high blood pressure. You can prepare with a whole beet with peel and everything in 200 to 250 milliliters of water. You blend it and drink it without filtering. You can add a little turmeric or ginger or mint, whatever you like best. Another option is to eat the vegetable raw, also with the peel and everything in your salads and if it is a little heavy or you don&#39;t like it raw, you can boil it for 5 to 10 minutes. No more than this so as not to lose its medicinal properties. You can also leave it steaming for a bit. In addition to all this, to control diabetes, don&#39;t forget to drink enough water. Do this for four weeks and then come back and comment below how it went. You&#39;ll be surprised. I hope you really liked the video. Subscribe to our channel. Share this material with your friends and family who have insulin resistance, metabolism problems and diabetes. This is how we can help them. A big greeting from my corner of the world. Bye Bye.

if you&#39;re a diabetic and love a good drink not all alcohol is off limits for diabetics in moderation you can still enjoy some drinks first up dry wines they have a low glycemic index they&#39;re low in carbs and sugar next light beers they typically have a glycemic index of around 5 to 10 light beers come in various types such as loggers alses and pilsners most light beers contain around 90 to 110 calories per serving Brands like Michelob Ultra Bud Light and cuse light are popular options always check the label for carb content for Spirit lovers opt for whiskey gin or vodka with sugar-free mixers these Spirits have a glycemic index of zero remember always drink water to stay hydrated and never drink on an empty stomach keep an eye on your blood sugar levels because alcohol can affect them in surprising ways so next time you&#39;re at a party you can sip smartly cheers to making informed choices with health funder

work out with me as a type 1 diabetic I had a busy workday So today we&#39;re headed in for an afternoon session my sugar is dropping a little bit at a 101 and we don&#39;t want that so I made myself this Greek yogurt snack with strawberries and honey normally when I have this snack I would add some granola or mixed nuts but since I wanted it to hit my body a little bit faster I skipped adding anything that would bump up the fat content I also skipped taking any insulin for this I would say this is about probably like 16 17 carbs it was also a leg day so I took some pre-workout as well I get asked about taking pre-work out as a type 1 diabetic a lot I don&#39;t personally do anything special I just drink it like normal and I don&#39;t notice my sugars doing anything crazy but I also only take it in the afternoon because morning times are always for coffee I arrived to the gym with a nice even arrow and a bump up in sugars a little bit and then honestly diabetes took it really easy on me today I just kept an eye on my sugars throughout my workout but as you can see like I stayed steady and I ended my workout at a beautiful 121 yay

five early signs of diabetes can often go unnoticed until they become more serious unexplained fatigue is one of those signs leaving individuals feeling drained even after a good night&#39;s sleep increased thirst follows closely behind as the body tries to combat high blood sugar levels frequent urination is another sign often disrupting daily activities as the kidneys work over time slow healing sores or frequent infections can indicate underlying issues with blood sugar levels unexplained weight loss can occur as well making individuals lose pounds even when they are eating normally sudden cravings for sugary Foods often plague those experiencing early signs of diabetes keeping an eye on these symptoms can lead to timely intervention and Better Health outcomes recognizing these signs early is crucial for managing diabetes effectively If you experience any of these symptoms consider Consulting a health care professional for guidance and support taking proactive steps by discussing concerns with a doctor

top six morning habits every diabetic should follow lower blood sugar managing diabetes is about consistency and smart choices and your morning routine plays a crucial role in setting the tone for stable blood sugar throughout the day many people unknowingly start their Mornings in ways that cause blood sugar spikes leading to fatigue cravings and insulin resistance but by making a few simple changes you can take control of your health and feel energized focused and balanced here are six powerful morning habits that can help lower blood sugar naturally and set you up for Success one start your day with hydration one of the simplest yet most powerful habits for managing diabetes is hydrating as soon as you wake up while many people reach for coffee or tea first thing in the morning drinking water before anything else can have a profound impact on blood sugar control and overall health overnight your body naturally loses water through breathing and metabolic processes if you wake up even slightly dehydrated your blood becomes more concentrated which can lead to higher blood sugar levels proper hydration helps flush out excess glucose through the kidneys making it easier for your body to maintain balance throughout the day water also plays a crucial role in digestion metabolism and circulation when you start your morning with a glass of water you are giving your body the support it needs to function efficiently hydration is particularly important for people with diabetes because dehydration can lead to insulin resistance making it harder for your cells to absorb glucose properly for those who find plain water unappealing adding a slice of lemon cucumber or fresh mint can provide subtle flavor without affecting blood sugar herbal teas without added sweeteners can also be a good alternative drinking enough water in the morning can also help curb cravings and prevent unnecessary snacking later in the day when the body is dehydrated it often sends hunger signals which can lead to consuming unnecessary calories and carbohydrates by making hydration a non-negotiable part of your morning routine you set a strong foundation for stable blood sugar levels improved energy and better overall well-being a simple habit like drinking water may seem small but over time it becomes a powerful tool in managing diabetes naturally two eat a protein and fiber rich breakfast the first meal of the day has a profound impact on blood sugar control energy levels and overall metabolic health for people with diabetes choosing a breakfast rich in protein and fiber is one of the most effective ways to prevent glucose spikes and sustain energy throughout the day in the morning the body is naturally more resistant to insulin due to hormonal fluctuations that occur overnight this means that consuming a high carbohydrate breakfast such as cereal pastries or white bread can quickly lead to a sharp rise in blood sugar followed by an inevitable crash this cycle not only affects energy levels but also increases Cravings making it harder to maintain stable glucose levels protein plays a critical role in slowing digestion and preventing rapid glucose absorption it provides the body with a essential amino acids supports muscle function and helps regulate hunger hormones fiber on the other hand adds bulk to meals and slows the release of glucose into the bloodstream preventing sudden blood sugar fluctuations together they create a balanced meal that promotes satiety reduces cravings and improves long-term blood sugar control ideal breakfast options include eggs with leafy greens and avocado Greek yogurt with nuts and seeds or a bowl of oatmeal with flax seeds and berries these meals provide a combination of protein fiber and healthy fats that nourish the body without overloading it with excess carbohydrates by making protein and fiber a priority in the morning you establish a steady foundation for blood sugar stability a well-balanced breakfast does more than satisfy hunger it fuels the body in a way that supports long-term Health enhances focus and makes diabetes management more effective throughout the day three limit caffeine or pair it with protein for many people the morning doesn&#39;t feel complete without a cup of coffee it provides Comfort warmth and the energy needed to start the day however for those managing diabetes caffeine can have a more complex effect on blood sugar than most realize while it does not contain carbohydrates or sugar caffeine stimulates the release of stress hormones such as cortisol and adrenaline which in turn signal the liver to release stored glucose into the bloodstream this response can cause an unexpected rise in blood sugar particularly for those with insulin resistance the way caffeine affects blood sugar varies from person to person some people may experience little to no impact While others might notice a significant increase in glucose levels after consuming coffee if blood sugar spikes occur consistently after drinking coffee it may be worth adjusting consumption habits one of the best ways to reduce caffeine&#39;s impact is to pair it with protein drinking coffee on an empty stomach can amplify its effects on blood sugar whereas having it with a protein rich breakfast can help slow glucose absorption and stabilize energy levels adding a scoop of protein powder collagen or unsweetened plant-based milk can also create a more balanced beverage for those who find that caffeine disrupts their blood sugar control switching to decaffeinated coffee or herbal teas may be a better option paying close attention to how the body responds to caffeine is essential for making informed decisions about morning routines by being mindful of caffeine intake and pairing it strategically with nourishing foods it is possible to enjoy the ritual of morning coffee while maintaining steady blood sugar levels and supporting overall health four move your body for 10 15 minutes physical movement in the morning is one of the most effective ways to naturally regulate blood sugar while many people think of exercise as something that requires a gym membership or an intense workout even a few minutes of movement in the morning can make a significant difference for those managing diabetes when the body moves the muscles actively use glucose for energy this process helps lower blood sugar levels without relying solely on insulin regular physical activity also improves insulin sensitivity meaning the body becomes more efficient at transporting glucose into the cells reducing the risk of blood sugar spikes throughout the day a short walk after breakfast gentle stretching or a simple body weight routine can activate the muscles and set up positive tone for the rest of the day walking in particular has been shown to help lower postmeal blood sugar levels even 10 minutes of movement can make a measurable impact preventing gluc from accumulating in the bloodstream and reducing the risk of energy crashes later in the day beyond blood sugar control movement supports circulation reduces stress hormones and enhances mental Clarity morning activity also boosts Mood by promoting the release of endorphins making it easier to stay motivated and focused incorporating movement into a morning routine does not need to be complicated the key is consistency a small habit like a short walk or a few minutes of yoga can become a powerful tool in long-term diabetes management by making movement a priority in the morning the body is better prepared to maintain stable blood sugar and sustain energy throughout the day five manage stress before it manages you morning stress can silently disrupt blood blood sug control yet many people Overlook its impact stress triggers the release of cortisol and adrenaline hormones that prepare the body for a fight ORF flight response while this reaction is natural it also signals the liver to release stored glucose into the bloodstream for people with diabetes this can lead to unexplained blood sugar spikes even before eating the first meal of the day starting the morning with a sense of calm and control contr can significantly improve glucose stability throughout the day the way the body responds to stress is deeply connected to how well it regulates insulin chronic stress not only raises blood sugar levels but also increases cravings for high carb and sugary Foods making it more difficult to maintain healthy eating habits one of the most effective ways to reduce morning stress is through intentional mindfulness practices deep Brea breathing exercises even for just a few minutes help lower cortisol levels and improve insulin sensitivity journaling gratitude or setting a positive intention for the day can shift the mindset from stress to focus gentle stretching or a short morning walk can further support relaxation by releasing tension and improving circulation small changes in the morning can prevent stress from taking control avoiding the Rush by waking up a little earlier reducing screen time upon waking and creating a calming routine can transform the way the body handles stress and blood sugar regulation by prioritizing mental well-being in the morning it becomes easier to navigate daily challenges with Clarity and resilience managing stress is not just about feeling better it is about making choices that support long-term diabetes health and overall well-being six eat an earlier dinner the night before the timing of your last meal plays a crucial role in determining your blood sugar levels the next morning many people focus on what they eat but often Overlook when they eat having a late dinner or snacking before bed can lead to higher fasting blood sugar levels increased insulin resistance and disrupted metabolism when you eat late at night your body has less time to process glucose before sleep during the night insulin sensitivity naturally decreases meaning the body does not manage blood sugar as efficiently as it does during the day this often results in elevated blood sugar levels in the morning making it harder to maintain balance throughout the day eating an earlier dinner allows the body to digest and metabolize food before sleep giving insulin a chance to work effectively studies suggests that people who finish dinner at least 2 to 3 hours before bedtime have better fasting glucose levels and improved overall metabolic Health aligning meal timing with the body&#39;s natural circadian rhythm supports better blood sugar regulation energy balance and digestion choosing a dinner rich in lean proteins fiber and healthy fats while minimizing processed carbohydrates can further support glucose stability overnight foods like grilled fish with roasted vegetables a salad with avocado and nuts or a bowl of lentil soup provide lasting nourishment without overwhelming the body&#39;s ability to manage blood sugar breaking the habit of late night eating is not always easy but small steps like setting a fixed dinner time avoiding late snacks and staying hydrated can create lasting improvements in blood sugar control an earlier dinner is not just about better numbers in the morning it is about giving your body the time it needs to rest recover and function at its best conclusion establishing a Mindful and structured morning routine is one of the most powerful ways to manage blood sugar naturally each of these six habits hydrating first thing in the morning eating a protein and fiber rich breakfast limiting caffeine or pairing it with protein moving the body for at least 10 minutes managing stress before it escalates and eating an earlier dinner the night before plays a critical role in stabilizing glucose levels and improving overall metabolic health for individuals prone to hypoglycemia these habits are equally important starting the day with with proper hydration and a well-balanced breakfast helps prevent sudden drops in blood sugar reducing the risk of dizziness fatigue and irritability corporating protein and fiber in the morning slows glucose absorption preventing drastic swings that can leave the body feeling weak or unsteady moderate physical activity further supports glucose regulation by ensuring that sugar is efficiently utilized by the muscles rather than left to fluctuate unpredictably in the bloodstream managing stress is particularly crucial for those who experience frequent low blood sugar episodes stress hormones such as cortisol can interfere with blood sugar stability making hypoglycemia episodes more difficult to predict and control by practicing relaxation techniques in the morning such as deep breathing or mindfulness individuals can create a sense of calm that carries throughout the day helping to regulate both energy and glucose levels the effectiveness of these habits is not seen in a single day but rather through consistent practice over time small intentional changes lead to long-term improvements in blood sugar management energy levels and overall well-being by prioritizing these simple yet impactful morning routines individuals with diabetes can take meaningful steps toward achieving Better Health and a greater sense of balance in daily life if you find these tips helpful please leave a comment with the number one and share your thoughts your feedback means so much to us don&#39;t forget to hit the like share and subscribe buttons on our YouTube channel to stay updated with more tips on managing your health and naturally lowering your blood sugar levels thank you for taking the time to watch this video live life your way and enjoy the journey toward a healthier and happier you wishing you good health and happiness

you could be living with diabetes right now and you wouldn&#39;t even know it diabetes doesn&#39;t just appear one day it slowly destroys the body until the damage becomes irreversible the truth is in most cases the body gives Clues tiny warnings that could save our life if we act fast but we don&#39;t know how to listen in this video I am going to share 10 early signs of diabetes that could save your life these symptoms are your body&#39;s way of warning you don&#39;t ignore them number one One Is frequent urination otherwise known as polyurea frequent urination might seem harmless but it could be your body&#39;s way of waving a red flag for diabetes when your blood sugar levels get too high your kidneys work over time to filter out the extra sugar to flush it out your body produces more urine this means you&#39;ll find yourself running to the bathroom way more than usual it&#39;s not just annoying it&#39;s a sign your body is struggling to balance itself if this happens often don&#39;t brush it off go get tested number two two extreme thirst extreme thirst is one of those signs your body gives when something isn&#39;t quite right and is often an early clue for diabetes here&#39;s why when your blood sugar levels are too high your kidneys step in to flush out the extra sugar they do this by making more urine which means you&#39;re losing a lot of water this process leaves your body dehydrated in response your brain sends out a strong signal to drink more and that&#39;s why you feel thirsty all the time The Thirst doesn&#39;t go away no matter how much water you drink because the root cause high blood sugar is still there if this is happening to you it&#39;s your body trying to tell you something important you might also notice frequent urination or a dry mouth along with this thirst if it doesn&#39;t seem normal and it&#39;s persistent it&#39;s time to see a doctor three unexplained weight loss unexplained weight loss might sound like a dream for some but it could actually be a warning sign of diabetes when your body can&#39;t use sugar that is glucose properly for energy because of insulin issues it starts breaking down fat and muscle for fuel instead this leads to a rapid drop in weight even if you&#39;re eating the same or more than usual it&#39;s not a healthy weight loss it&#39;s your body struggling to find energy because the sugar it needs is stuck in your bloodstream instead of getting into your cells this process can also leave you feeling tired and weak if you&#39;ve noticed significant weight loss without trying combined with other symptoms like frequent urination or extreme thirst it&#39;s worth getting checked out your body might be giving you a clear signal that something is off number four fatigue fatigue is more than just being sleepy it&#39;s a persistent lack of energy that doesn&#39;t go away no matter how much rest you get if you have diabetes your body struggles to turn sugar into energy because of insulin issues this means your cells aren&#39;t getting the fuel they need leaving you feeling completely worn out on top of that high blood sugar can cause dehydration and inflammation both of which add to the exhaustion it&#39;s a vicious cycle you feel tired but no amount of rest or caffeine seems to fix it if this fatigue is constant and comes with other symptoms like frequent urination or unexplained weight loss it&#39;s a red flag your body is telling you it&#39;s struggling and it&#39;s important to listen number five blurry vision have you noticed things looking blurry lately it might not just be your eyes it could be diabetes when blood sugar levels are high they can affect the fluid levels in your eyes high blood sugar pulls fluid from different parts of your body including your eyes this changes the shape of your eyes lens making it hard for you to focus and causing things to look blurry what makes this symptom tricky is that it&#39;s not always constant the blurriness might come and go depending on your blood sugar levels if left untreated diabetes can cause lasting damage to your eyes including conditions like diabetic retinopathy if blurry vision appears suddenly especially alongside other symptoms like fatigue or excessive thirst it&#39;s worth checking your blood BL sugar don&#39;t let your vision be the price of ignoring the signs before we proceed I&#39;d really appreciate it if you could give this video a thumbs up it helps get this video in front of more people on YouTube thanks and let&#39;s continue another early sign of diabetes you should always watch out for is numbness and tingling numbness or tingling in your hands and feet can be an early warning sign of diabetes when blood sugar levels stay high for a long time it can damage your nerves especially in your extremities this is called called diabetic neuropathy and it often starts with a feeling of pins and needles or a loss of sensation in your fingers Toes or both at first it might seem mild or happen only occasionally but over time it can become constant and even painful if the nerves continue to be affected this happens because high blood sugar disrupts blood flow to the nerves cutting off the nutrients they need to stay healthy if you&#39;re noticing these Sensations don&#39;t ignore them number seven is slow wound healing wounds that take forever to heal might seem like a minor annoyance but they could be a serious sign of diabetes high blood sugar causes poor circulation meaning less blood gets to the injury site without enough oxygen and nutrients your body can&#39;t repair the damage as quickly as it should to make matters worse high blood sugar weakens your immune system slowing down your body&#39;s defense against infections this is why even small Cuts or scrapes can linger for weeks or turn into something worse you might notice bruises fading slower or tiny Nicks refusing to close if you&#39;re dealing with slow healing wounds don&#39;t ignore them especially if you&#39;re also experiencing symptoms like thirst fatigue or frequent urination it&#39;s your body&#39;s way of hinting that blood sugar levels might be out of control number eight extreme hunger if you&#39;re always hungry no matter how much you eat it could be a sign of diabetes when your body struggles with insulin sugar can&#39;t enter your cells to provide energy instead it stays in your blood bloodstream leaving your cells empty and your stomach growling for more this constant hunger also called polyphasia might lead you to eat more but it doesn&#39;t solve the issue your cells are still starving and the cycle continues if this extreme hunger comes with other symptoms like unexplained weight loss blurry vision or fatigue it&#39;s time to see a doctor Nine dark patches on the skin dark patches on the skin especially in areas like the neck armpits elbows or groin could be an early sign of diabetes this condition is called acanthosis nigricans it happens when your body has too much insulin a hormone that helps control blood sugar levels when insulin builds up in your bloodstream due to insulin resistance it can trigger skin cells to grow faster than normal these new skin cells produce extra pigment making the affected areas appear darker and thicker the patches often feel soft and velvety to the touch a kosis Niger can is not harmful by itself but it&#39;s a warning sign that your body isn&#39;t using insulin properly which can lead to type 2 diabetes these patches may show up gradually and might even go unnoticed at first if you see them especially alongside symptoms like extreme hunger thirst or fatigue it&#39;s worth getting checked out and lastly frequent infections if you&#39;re getting infections more often than usual it could be your body&#39;s way of hinting that something is wrong possibly diabetes here&#39;s why when your blood sugar levels are consistently High it weakens your immune system by interfering with the function of white blood cells these cells are your body&#39;s first line of defense against germs and when they don&#39;t work properly your ability to fight off infections drops significantly at the same time high blood sugar creates an ideal environment for bacteria and fungi to grow making it easier for infections to take hold and harder for your body to recover you might notice issues like recurrent yeast infections frequent urinary tract infections slow healing Cuts or wounds or even repeated colds these aren&#39;t just coincidences they&#39;re warning signs your body doesn&#39;t develop these problems for no reason it&#39;s trying to alert you to a deeper issue and ignoring these signs could delay a diagnosis if this sounds familiar consider getting your blood sugar tested catching diabetes early can make a huge difference in how well it&#39;s managed so don&#39;t wait your health is worth it if this video helped you learn something new please like share and subscribe
